comm: just works away this fuller length outside off towards the mid-on fielder

Mathews just moved the second slip as Finch edges this back of a length which swings away, to Mahela, at first slip, who is unable to grasp this as it falls low to his right. Ends up being picked up near third man. Hard to call it a dropped chance as this was definitely going to the second slip. Really difficult for someone even of Mahela's class
defends back this length delivery towards the bowler
defended by Warner to the off side
looks to force away a shot through the covers, but picks out the close-in fielder
shortish length which he is able to squirt away square off the wicket for three runs. The batsmen really hustled the first two hard to make this possible.
goes round the wicket as he drifts in one on middle and leg which is fended away towards mid-off
gets on the back foot to punch this away to long off
plays at this one floated up on middle and leg quite tentatively as it is defended to the leg side
is well early on this sweep round the corner to this leg-side delivery, with Sangakkara trying to get at the ball as it bobbled near him, but is unable to get to it
Finch goes for the drive and gets an inside egde to midwicket
continues operating this leg-stump line as this one is now tickled away through fine leg
good length delivery swinging away outside off stump. Finch defends off the front foot to point
length delivery which is defended on the front foot
just a bit wide as Finch is able to free his arms and scythe this away beautifully through cover point for a boundary
fuller length, with a hint of away swing, as this one is steered away towards point
looks to punch through extra-cover now, with the fielder able to stop this in the end inside of the ring
plays this one close to the body outside his off stump as they scamper through for the quick single
defends this one away to the off side before noticing the space between the ball and the fielder at cover, so they decide to go through for the single
goes round the wicket as Warner is able to skip down to this floated delivery on middle as he chips inside-out over extra-cover for a boundary
defended back to the bowler on the front foot
this time shifts onto the back foot to defend the bowler away
sliding down the leg-side as Warner paddles this over towards deep midwicket
looks to tuck away Sachi through backward square, but is unable to do so in the end
there is the quintessential Malinga yorker. Fires this one in on middle and leg which is dug out successfully by Warner through the leg side

what a set-up from Malinga! this time takes off the pace of this length delivery on middle and off, deceiving Warner as he offers a half-hearted push which finds it way to extra-cover, who is able to take it comfortably. Huge blow for Australia as Warner has to go
shuffles over to the off side as this attempted yorker on leg misses its mark, with the umpire calling a wide. Smith had shuffled over too much, so is lucky that Malinga did not find the target
fuller length sent in round-arm on off as this one is defended away towards mid-off
once again gets forward to this length delivery outside his off stump
full delivery on middle and leg which is clipped away to mid-on
caresses this fuller length outside off as this beats extra-cover to find the boundary .Steven Smith shows some of that wonderful class he exhibited in the India-Australia Tests last year
goes round the wicket as this one is defended back carefully to the bowler
this time straying on leg-stump as Finch is able to sweep this round the corner to find a boundary through long leg
now given some width as this is dragged across him, with Finch placing this down to sweeper cover, stealing three runs in the end as this one is pulled back before the rope
guides away a single now through long on to get Finch back on strike
gets forward to this drifted delivery on middle and leg
gets onto the back foot as this one is defended back to the bowler

looks to drive this one past the extra-cover fielder, with the misfield allowing him the run, but he wanted two all the time as he turns back quickly. Finch, who was running to the danger end, is just able to make his ground before Malinga is able to collect and whip off the bails at the non-striker's
defended away to the off side by the batsman
length delivery outside of off which is allowed to carry through
similar line, but perhaps a touch shorter, as this is left well alone
looks to clip away the bowler through midwicket, but the silly mid-on is not having any of it
gets in a good stride before fending away this Malinga length delivery to the off side
begins with a loosener on middle and leg which is driven away through long on for three runs
fuller length, wide of off, which is watched carefully by the batsman

appears to strike Smith's back pad on and around off as he got forward. Mathews goes up for a vociferous appeal, but is turned out. After a brief consultation, decides he wants the review. Replays confirm that this ball may have just struck outside off, as they now check for the inside-edge, which doesn't appear to be there. The original decision stands after everything has been checked.
fuller one outside of off which is allowed to go through after he initially looked to flirt with it
gets in a good stride to bunt this length delivery away to the off side
turned away to the leg side to end a good over from Mathews
drifts one in on middle and leg which is struck back to him in his follow through
strays a bit too far down the leg side now as this is swept away through fine leg for a boundary
darted in on middle and off as this is cut away to the man at point

Prasanna you beauty! Removes the ever-dangerous Finch with a slider down the leg side which Finch attacked early as he played down the wrong line. Sangakkara does the rest as he picks this up and flicks the bails in one fluid motion as Finch looks back disconcertingly. Huge roar from the Sri Lankans as Finch makes his way back to the pavilion
defends this one darted in back to the bowler
tries to cut away through backward point, but picks out one of those four fielders on the off side
back of a length outside of off which is allowed to go through to the keeper
another length delivery, this time a bit wider now from Mathews, as Smith continues to give respect
punches away this back of a length towards the covers
full delivery on middle and leg which is met with the full face as this is driven beautifully through long on for a boundary. Just pushed at it really as this raced away across the outfield
Dilshan gets the Sri Lankan fans off their feet with an athletic stop at backward point to his left as Smith looked to glide away through backward point
elegant drive on the up through point to find the boundary rope in good time. Executed quite beautifully in the end
looks like he read that one well as he shoulders arms to this one drifted in outside of off, before turning away
huge appeal as Clarke is struck in front after advancing down a bit, but looks like he may have been struck outside as the umpire remained unmoved
gets away a single through sweeper cover to get to the other end
defended away to the leg side by Smith
works away the bowler through cover point to get a single
targets the gap at cover to retain the strike for the next over
clipped away through to deep midwicket for one
fends away this one drifted in towards backward point
comes down before easing away a drive through deep midwicket
shimmies down a touch before easing away the ball to long on
guided away through long on as these two continue to rotate the strike
tries to get past the man at short midwicket, but ends up locating him instead
flighted on middle and leg as he waltzes down before clipping away towards deep midwicket
tosses one up on and around off as this is driven down to long off
driven firmly down towards the man at wide long off
flights this one wide of off as this is driven away to deep cover
now picks up a single to the man at a deepish mid-on
shimmies a touch before placing this with a drive to deep extra-cover
freely comes down the track before just nudging this one past the bowler to his right, who tried his best to get to it with a dive
eased away to long on for a single
pushed away off the back foot towards the bowler
looks to clip this one away through the leg-side, with this one going in the air temporarily before falling away
pulled away now to deep square-leg for one
width given outside off, but Clarke fails to get away this cut through backward point after he picks out the fielder
begins with a length delivery outside off which is struck to the silly mid-off fielder
delivery outside off which is driven away off the back foot through the covers
looking to guide one away through the off side, before mishitting this one to midwicket in the end
nudges away a single through midwicket to get to the other end
overpitched outsid off and driven with ease through long on to just get it past the mid-on fielder for a boundary
defended away off the back foot to the leg side to end the over
tries to force away this one drifted on middle and leg through mid-on, but is unsuccessful in the attempt after the silly mid-on fielder gets behind the ball
the carrom ball outside off stump, cut to backward point
steps out and flicks the flighted delivery to deep midwicket
shimmies down before clipping away the bowler through long on
Clarke is opened up by the drift away from him on this slider as he get a thickish edge, which luckily for him falls away from any harm
picks up two through deep extra-cover as Malinga fires in a throw at the non-striker's, but is late in the end
length delivery just outside of off which is defended by the batsman
length delivery on middle and off which is fended away by the batsman
straying on the pads as this is glanced away through square-leg
short of a length outside his off stump which is run down towards a squarish third man
covers the line of this back of a length which just nibbles in a touch outside his off stump
shuffles over before clipping this length delivery through midwicket for one
eases away this one drifted in by the spinner through long on
gets in a good stride as this ball is turned away to the leg side
sliding down leg as he shimmies down before directing this away through square-leg
gets in a good jab to find the man at extra-cover
looking to come down as this one is steered away to the fielder at deep midwicket
defended from the relative safety of his crease to bring drinks onto the field
full delivery which is struck away to the man at mid-on
fuller one outside off which Smith is late on as he tried to scythe this away through the off side
angling onto middle and leg as this is tucked away behind of square
straying on a leg-stump line as this is helped away with the angle with a pull to backward square
short of a length and heading down the leg side as this one is worked away off the back foot for a single
looking to force away a drive on the up through cover point, but doesn't time it well at all
comes down the track as Mathews puts in a fine stop at mid-on, much to the appreciation of this significant Sri Lankan fan-base at the ground
flighted and on the stumps, turned towards the on side
defended carefully back to the bowler
comes down a bit before guiding this away through mid-on
defended from within the confines of his crease
width on offer as he cuts this away through cover for a single
short of a length which is defended from the back foot
defended away to the man at backward point as they continue to look only for the bad balls
width outside off which is caressed away to sweeper cover
slaps away this fuller length to the same fielder as he gets to the other end
shortish length which is worked away through third man by the batsman
opts for the calculated bludgeon over long on, which he pulls off quite well in the end as this goes all the way to the boundary for four
comes down the track before steering this one straight to the midwicket fielder
this time tries to force away a straight drive past the bowler, but Prasanna is able to leap to his left in his follow through to pounce on the ball
Malinga shows nifty footwork on the boundary edge at sweeper cover after this cut from Smith almost makes its way to the rope
slower and just outside off. Smith presses forward in defence
advances down before striking this straight to the man at short cover on the bounce
Smith comes down the track, takes the ball on the full, and drives it straight to MJ at silly mid-on
tossed up and on off, Clarke comes down the track and drives it straight to cover
glances away a run just behind of square, with Clarke running hard for the second to just make it in before the throw, which was collected by Sangakkara, came in
steered away now through long on for one
tucked away round the corner to find deep fine leg
defended from the crease after he initially looked to flutter down the track
defended on the front foot to end the over. Australia have also moved to 100 after that single from the fourth ball. Has been a good recovery after losing Finch for just under 50 on the board
comes down the track before locating midwicket with a clip
dances down before guiding this one past a sprawling Prasanna to find long off
width given and with backward point short on the off side, Smith is able to cut this one away powerfully through the region to pickup a useful boundary
waltzes down before steering away the bowler through long on
struck away hard through mid-off, with the fielder putting in a dive to cut this off
just gets it past the silly mid-on to pickup a single through long on
sliding down leg as this one is turned away through midwicket for a single
eased away now to long on for one
Malinga does well at deep backward square after Clarke pulled this away to try and find the boundary
nudged away towards the leg side by Smith
comes down a touch before offering a chance to Dilshan, who leaps low to his left to try and turn this into a caught-and-bowled. Ends up being picked up at a deepish mid-off position
gets to a deserved World Cup fifty with a paddle through fine leg to this one sliding in on middle and leg. Has been a calming presence for Australia out in the middle
gets away this loosener from the SL captain with a clip through to deep midwicket
glides away the medium-pacer through third man for one
has a nibble at this back of a length which just shapes away as the extra bounce may have saved him there as it carried through to the keeper
carves away a drive through mid-off as the misfield near the ring allows Clarke some bonus runs
fuller one which is flicked away through deep square-leg
looking for the heave through long on, but ends up getting away an inside-edge through backward square
defended with a firm push as this makes it way down to long on
comes down the track before working away Dilshan through the same region
struck away now through long off, with the fielder coming round to field
looking to target the vacant space at long leg, but ends up locating the protection kept at deep backward square
looking for the forceful bludgeon through extra-cover, but is not able to get this away as he would have liked as this is reined in before the rope
eases away a run down to long on to end the over
offers up a hit-me length outside of off as Clarke is able to play a crisp, expansive drive through the covers to find the boundary
lovely push now down the ground which he doesn't quite time away as this is picked up by the long on fielder
first sight of a short ball all day as this one is allowed to carry through outside of off to the keeper. Called wide by the leg umpire
gets nicely behind this back of a length outside his off stump
dabs away this short of a length outside his off stump to third man
jabbed away off the back foot through midwicket for a comfortable single
turns away this length delivery through the same region to keep the strike
steers the spinner through long on for a comfortable single
half-trekker doesn't quite come out of the hand properly as Clarke picks this early to belt this over extra-cover for a boundary
now cuts away through to sweeper cover to move to 49. Also brings up their 100-run stand
works with the leg-side slant of the delivery to tickle this away through fine leg
nurdles a single to deep midwicket as Clarke moves to fifty. Met with generous applause from the SCG faithful. Has really been an excellent, guiding hand as Australia look to build a platform
Smith decides this last one has to go, as he gets down the track to lift the bowler, although not in total control, over long off to just sail over the boundary into the stands
punches away this length delivery towards extra-cover, with the fielder able to field this after the misfield from short mid-off
defends this slow back of a length delivery to the bowler
looking to target deep extra-cover with a chip before getting away a slice through third man for one
steered away on the front foot through the off side
length delivery straying on the pads as Clarke picks his spot at deep backward square to get away a boundary before the chasing boundary rider from square-leg
full and in the slot as this time Clarke lifts over long off to find the boundary rope after a couple of bounces. Has really paced this innings superbly so far.
operates a leg-stump line as Smith is able to glance this away square off the wicket
drags the length as he hammers the spinner inside-out over extra-cover, with Perera doing well to stop this with his foot before it reached the rope
tucks away this one off the pads through backward square
tries to paddle away fine through fine leg as he is mindful of Malinga at leg slip, but doesn't get enough on it to reach the boundary
this time shifts the line on middle and off as Smith is able to cut this away fiercely through the covers for a boundary. Had no margin for error there with only one man out on the off side
steered straight back to the bowler to end a good over for Australia
short enough for Clarke to pull square off the wicket as this just slows up before the boundary rope, with the fielder picking this up
gets the yorker wrong as he dishes a low, full toss which is instinctively struck away to long on
again searching for the blockhole as this is hit away on the full to mid-on
third time not the charm for Malinga as he looks for yet another yorker on off which Clarke middles away through long off to pick up a boundary. Just timed it away beautifully really

Malinga shows why he is the best in the business when it comes to these moments as he displaces the base of middle and leg with a fierce leg-stump half-volley that hits the mark. Clarke, looking for quick runs through long on, plays all around it. Hang on, though, as Malinga may have just overstepped here. Clarke may just get called back here as he lands the back of the foot just on the line. In the end, Clarke continues off as the skipper has to go for a run-a-ball 68
bowls a peach of a yorker, almost similar to the one that did in Clarke, as Maxwell is able to dig this one out towards the leg side
looks to force away a drive through the covers, but is held by the silly mid-off fielder
gets away a punch square off the wicket on the off side

and now it is Steven Smith's time to go as he looks for a tonk straight down the ground, with this one swirling high in the air before Thisara, somewhere between long off and extra-cover, is able to get under it and take it before falling away. Met with great excitement by the SL fans as Smith storms away after a brilliantly played 72
driven away by Maxwell through deep extra-cover as he crosses over for the single
defended from within the confines of his crease
defends away this one drifted in on middle and leg to the leg side
tries to nudge away a single on the leg side, but doesn't get it away
steered towards the off side, but finds the close-in fielder
Maxwell has faced enough balls now for him to go hard at this one floated on off as he finds the long off boundary with ease
unfurls the powerful reverse-sweep to sweeper cover to get to the other end
Watson a touch tentative as he turned this delivery away to midwicket
Watson reaches out to this one floated just outside off before padlding away dangerously close to Sangakkara's outstretched gloves over fine leg, which he is able to avoid in the end
flighted from the bowler as Maxwell is lucky to get away with this mistimed strike high over cover, with three fielders converging before this fell in between
content to defend this one back to the bowler in his follow through
Maxwell doesn't quite time this chip over extra-cover, doing just enough to get over the cover fielder to the boundary
sends this one sailing high and mighty over long off now as he definitely got a hold of this. Maxwell looking to play his natural game here
sensibly gets away a clip through midwicket as he looked for the second, but is dissuaded once he sees the fielder pick up the ball in the field
able to work away a run through fine leg to retain the strike for the first over of the Batting Powerplay
short delivery which is hooked away rather awkwardly by Watto towards long leg
fires in a yorker on the toes which is flicked away to short midwicket
another yorker which follows Maxwell as he backed away in hopes of creating space
another beauty targeting the base of middle and off as Maxwell digs this out
gets away a shot through extra-cover, which is pounced upon by the fielder
full delivery slipping down the pads as this is flicked away fine behind of square, but he didn't place it into the gap as this one is pulled up before the rope
tossed up and on the stumps, driven down towards long on for a single

Maxwell shows just why he is the package as he fetches this one on off before slamming it over deep backward square with a flick. Incredible shot as there really wasn't anything different Prasanna could have done there
picks up a pair through deep midwicket with a forceful clip

unbelievable skill from Maxwell! takes this one tossed up on off before dispatching it with a reverse-paddle flick through third man for four. More of a switch hit really, but it got the result he wanted
the lofted flick now, flighted delivery and just outside off, Maxwell picks out the gap at wide long on, Chandimal gets across and keeps them down to a couple
able to get away a flick through to deep midwicket as he completes a brace
leg-stump half-volley from Malinga which is flicked away behind square on the on side for a couple of runs
hooks the bowler now through to long leg to get Maxwell on strike

just too good. Simply too good. Maxwell takes on one of the best bowlers in the game as he lines up this yorker on middle with an aerial scythe through extra-cover to find the boundary. Predictable from Malinga, but Maxwell still managed to put him away
slower delivery on and around leg which is struck away towards long on as Maxwell helps raise the fifty-run partnership between these two
Watson has a wry smile as he pushes at this fuller delivery outside off to find the boundary at long on
Watson looks to have carried on from Maxwell here as he now hooks this shorter delivery on leg through backward square to make it consecutive boundaries
gets this slower ball horribly wrong as Maxwell carts this full toss away to deep midwicket for a brace
provides him some pace now, which Maxwell laps up as he heaves over deep midwicket to just get this over the rope. Brings up yet another World Cup fifty, this one coming off just 26 balls.
just can't keep him quiet as he gets to the other end after this attempted pickup shot through fine leg fails to come off
meets this back of a length delivery outside of off, but can't pinch the run
turns away this back of a length through midwicket to get  to the other end
slower delivery which Maxwell tried to get up and under as he waited on it, but ends up getting through the stroke late as it continued through to the keeper
looking to go full and straight as this one dips away to the leg side. Watson manages to bissect the tight gap between deep fine leg and square leg with a flick that bursts through to the boundary
dishes up a low, full toss on middle and off which is re-directed away through square-leg

low, full toss on the pads as he misses again for the blockhole. Maxwell tried to get under it in hopes of getting it over the deep at midwicket, but ends up hitting this away to the deep fine leg fielder
chips away this attempted yorker on middle and leg, getting this towards midwicket, but thankfully, not all the way to the fielder as he didn't quite middle this
slower, length delivery going down leg which Maxwell clears his front leg to before arriving slightly early for the pick-up shot over the leg side, with the ball crashing into his stomach
another attempted yorker which is sent straying down the leg side. Maxwell could have left this alone to be called wide, but ends up getting a bat on it to flick it away behind of square
darts one in on middle which is slammed quite flat over deep midwicket for a boundary
another one which allows Maxwell some pace to manipulate as he now works this away behind of square on the leg side with a paddle
looks to target the gap at deep extra-cover as he lifts this one softly to the region, but didn't get enough on it to reach the rope
waits on this one flighted in on middle and leg before striking this away through cow corner for a boundary
looks for the slice over the covers as this one lands a few bounces before the deep cover fielder. Gets Maxwell of strike, much to Prasanna's delight
works with the leg-side slant to pickup a brace behind of square
what can you do when you are bowling to this? length delivery which Maxwell is able to switch-hit away through third man for a boundary. Looked way too comfortable as that was executed
full delivery outside of off as this is drilled straight to mid-off. Fastest World Cup century on the cards here

dropped I thought I may have just committed the most cardinal of sins after that last proclamation. Maxwell, who was looking to lift this fuller delivery over fine leg with a pick-up shot, ends up skying this high over long leg, with the fielder in the deep running full tilt to try and get under the catch, but is unable to quite grasp it
dabs away a run through third man as the Show gets back on strike
just content to nurdle a run over to the leg side as Watson gets to the other end
carves away a run through to deep cover to finish off the over
gets this one horribly wrong as he dishes a full toss which is swatted away baseball-style through midwicket for a flat six
content to just guide away a single through long on to get Maxxie boy on strike
even his mishits seem to get to the rope as he mistimes this attempt cart through midwicket to flat-bat this over long off, with this just beating the dive from the boundary rider to the rope
delivers a fuller, slow delivery which Maxwell drills straight to the cover fielder
just waits on this slower delivery outside off before dispatching it with a pull over midwicket for six. Unbelievable ball-striking from Maxwell!
searching for the wide yorker as he strays too far down the margin
looking for some runs through midwicket, as he is able to power through the first to get back for the second in the nick of time to get into the 90s. Met with generous applause from the SCG crowd
Watson is dialed in now as Mathews delivers a full delivery which is tonked high over cow corner for six. Is looking in ominous form at the moment
looks to reach out to this length delivery well wide of off, which is called wide by the umpire
trying to bowl another wide one which is slapped away to deep point by Watson

now it is Maxwell's turn as he inches ever closer to the record with a hard slap over the covers to this fuller length on and around off. Just slapped it away really, but went to the boundary at a rate of knots

dropped when it is your day, it is your day. Not even the great Sangakkara can stop this assault as Maxwell, looking for the unorthodox ramp over fine leg, ends up skying this high through deep fine leg, with Sanga haring on this before putting in a dive towards the right, but fails to take this. Looks frustrated as he realised the significance of that blunder
Maxwell now moves to 96 with a scythe towards extra-cover
slower ball just outside off which is fended away by Watson to the off side
sends this low, full toss from Malinga straight over his head, but didn't quite middle it as it was pulled up by the fielder in the deep
and he won't get the record as he now moves to 99 off 49 with a nudge towards mid-on. Perhaps he wasn't aware of the record?
sends in a full delivery on the base of middle which is struck away through long on to get the show on strike

just crazy from the SCG. Everyone at the ground thought he had got to it with this attempted clip off the pads to this slow, length delivery from Malinga, but it is called leg bye after the initial confusion. There was an appeal for leg before, but the umpire was not interested. Maxwell still on 99...
defended by the batsman
fires in a yorker on leg which is dug away towards the direction of long on
Watson fetches this one floated just outside off before dispatching it over fine leg with a lovely, lofted paddle sweep

width given as Shane picks his spot straight back past the bowler to get to his fifty with a hard slap that screams away straight back for four. A welcome return of form I am sure, not only for team management, but all of Australia as well
digs out this one darted in on middle and leg with a tuck away through midwicket. Huge cheer goes off as Maxwell is brought back on strike, and he is still on 99. Hasn't got an ODI hundred yet...

chips Prasanna over long off as he exults in pure joy after completing the runs. Has been a wonderful maiden ODI century for Maxwell as he bear hugs Watson, exhibiting some rather raw emotions out there. Has been a stunning knock so far
sensibly steers this next one down to long on to get off the strike
sweeps this one tossed up on middle and leg as he sweeps square off the wicket to just get this one over the boundary. It is all falling into place for Australia at the moment

and the curtains are drawn on yet another Maxwell blinder as he fails to get away this full-toss delivey from Perera, with this going straight up over mid-on, with Malinga doing well to complete the catch, with a tumble to finish. Maxwell hasn't yet departed as they are looking at the front foot no ball. No issues there as he was miles behind the crease. Looks like this was also a legitimate delivery as it didn't arrive to him over waist height. Has to depart after what has been one of the super innings of the tournament so far
Watson scythes away this fuller delivery outside off to the man at cover to get Faulkner on strike

in the slot again as Faulkner is obligated to get to the other end after he hears Watson's call. Drilled this to the fielder at cover, who is able to pick it up and throw it to Perera at the non-striker's, who is able to flick off the bails before Faulkner grounded his bat. Bonus wicket for Sri Lanka as Faulkner goes for a golden duck
picks up a couple through long on as they are able to hustle the first one hard enough to come back for the second in time of the throw

I am almost positive Glenn has departed from the middle as Watto channels his inner Maxwell with this slice over deep extra-cover which he falls away on as he groped at the full delivery. Ends up landing near the boundary, and then getting over the rope, before the boundary rider from sweeper cover could get there
sensibly guides away a single through midwicket to retain the strike
follows him with a yorker on leg as this is clipped away by Watson through midwicket
very full outside off stump as Haddin drives it to mid-off and sets off
makes room and drills this full ball very hard, but straight to mid-off
again makes room, but Slinga bowls a pin-point yorker to keep Watto honest
Watson sends another slice over extra-cover, with this one picked up in the deep by the fielder
careened away inside-out to the extra-cover fielder, who is more than equal to the task

Haddin reminds Sri Lanka of his presence with this powerful strike over extra-cover which just sails over the boundary. Perera dished up a length delivery which Haddin took care of in his own inimitable way

shuffles a bit in his crease before lasering this fuller delivery from Perera past the extra-cover fielder, who fails to get behind it as it bursts through to the boundary. Mathews was the culprit there
now targets the vacant space at long off with a heave which clears the mid-off fielder on the ring comfortably

Perera. It's okay. These things can happen in cricket... fires in a yorker on leg which Haddin somehow gets a feather of an inside-edge to as this screams away through fine leg for four. Perera would be feeling mighty hard done by that effort

dropped really symbolises the kind of day Sri Lanka has had so far as the fielder at deep midwicket drops the ball when Haddin sends an uppish flick over the region. Prasanna was the man in the deep, as he has a rather sheepish look on his face

Watson now looking for the long blast over long off, but Chandimal who is able to settle under this top-edge, is able to complete a catch finally in the deep. Ends a fantastic knock from Watson who has done his World Cup campaign a whole lot of good with this effort
just gets bat on ball to caress this fuller length going across towards the covers. Gets Haddin back on strike
overpitched delivery on middle and leg which Haddin is able to get up and under as he flicks this one through backward square for four

slower length delivery now which Haddin looks to send orbiting over Sydney, but ends up slicing away over to cover, who is able to get under it safely. Has to go as Australia look to rack up as many as possible off these final deliveries

hammers away this length delivery through long on, with Johnson wanting two from the get-go. The fielder in the deep pounces on this before sending in flat throw to Mathews, who is able to knock over the stumps before Starc had grounded his bat. The second run was never really on there, but you got to do what you got to do
heaves this fuller delivery towards deep midwicket, but is held to just the one after this arrived a bit too quickly to the fielder
length delivery shaping away as he fails to make any connection with this, but they still end up running the bye as Sangakkara has a shy at the stumps
on a good length and on the stumps, Thirimanne prods across and defends it towards mid-on
tad fuller and on the stumps, Thirimanne pushes it to the right of mid-on and sets off for a quick single
swing and a miss from Dilshan, went chasing after a full ball that nipped away, doesn't connect with the drive
Starc keeps it very full and well outside off, Dilshan looks to steer it towards third man, the ball beats the outside edge
fraction too short and on Dilshan's pads, worked wide of mid-on for a single
on a good length and just outside off, Thirimanne defends it with an open face
tries to get away this length delivery off the pads with an attempted flick off the pads, but is late on it
much better from Dilshan, tad fuller and just outside off, he gets half-forward and pushes it back past the bowler, the timing isn't spot on but the batsmen run well and get back for the third run
tucks away this length delivery on middle and leg towards the leg side

bowls a fantastic back of a length outside of off which cramps Lahiru for space, with the extra bounce catching the outside edge of his bat to fly over to the keeper behind, who snaps it up gleefully. Australia pick up one early as Sri Lanka look to mow down this huge chase
short of a length outside of off which is allowed to go through to the keeper
shortish length which Sangakkara is able to get on top off as the over comes to a close
looks to crash Starc through the covers, but is late on this as it just nibbles away from the outside edge of his bat. Got great carry across the batsman there
manages to get away a thick outside edge through third man as he looked to target the covers once more
defends this back of a length at the top of the bounce, and close to his body
huge "oooh" goes across the ground as he delivers this slightly back of a length which just straightens as it rushes past Sanga's bat
shortish length tailing down leg which is tucked away by Sangakkara quite competently
glances away this back of a length off the hips to end the over
length on middle and leg which is defended away to the leg side by Dilshan
fires in a ful, wide delivery outside off which arrives slower than his missiles before as Dilshan digs this one away to the off side
gets away a drop single through mid-off to bring Sangakkara on strike
jabs away this slightly back of a length through extra-cover as they are able to return for the second after hustling through the first run
shortish length which Sangakkara is able to manipulate through backward square with a rather awkward pull that just makes it away. Not the most convincing shot, but it got the result he wanted
fires in a pacey delivery on middle and leg which raps the top of Sangakkara's pads as he looked to glance away the delivery, but there was a definite inside-edge. Sent that in at 149kph!
searching for the slightly wide yorker as he offers up a low full toss which Dilshan fails to punish away through the covers
now flicks away the pacer behind of square on the leg side for a brace
fuller length, going across Dilly, as this one is sent away to the close-in fielder on the leg side
delivers a shortish length which Dilshan looked to climb into as he went for the hook, but thankfully this one lands safe around deep fine leg as there were no fielders in the vicinity
pitches one up on middle and off which is struck back to him on his follow through
eases away this fuller delivery through long off as they run a couple
overpitched from Mitch as this one is driven through long off quite comfortably for a boundary
and again, this time straighter from Dilshan, as he pays the price once more for delivering in the slot
makes it three in a row as he raises the roof at the SCG with a heave to this fuller delivery on off, sending this high over deep midwicket before it landed at the rope after a couple of bounces
Dilshan is taking on Mitchell at the SCG as he pulls this shortish length from the left-arm pacer over backward square to make it four in four. Really got that one out of the screws.

Mitchell is being taken to the cleaners here as he smokes away this overpitched length outside off through the covers for a boundary. Has already taken 20 from the over, and there is still a delivery to go. Mitchell just turns back and heads to his bowling mark

Dilshan makes it six in a row as he initially looked to play at this fuller delivery before noticing the change of pace to adjust his shot as he pushed at the length to get it away to the extra-cover boundary. The outfield makes sure this reaches the target in the end
a huge cheer rings across the ground as Sangakkara appears to have pushed this length delivery through the gap at extra-cover, but is pulled back before the rope
Dilshan is putting on a master-class as he plays his treasured 'Dilscoop' to this length delivery on middle and leg, which he sends through fine leg with the paddle
gets down the wicket now as he tries to crash away a boundary through long on, with the keeper collecting the take from behind
tries to be cute again with a straight ramp over the keeper, but instead gets struck on the helmet as the ball ends up near short third man. Lucky to escape with his head, literally, there
Sangakkara feeling a bit left out now as he slaps away this length delivery just behind of square on the off side for a boundary
calmly dabs away a single towards third man to end another good over for Sri Lanka
just oozes class as he drives on the up to this back of a length outside off as he finds the sweeper cover boundary with panache
now looking to guide this fuller one on middle and leg through mid-on, but picks out the fielder
misses out on this overpitched delivery outside off, as he locates the man at mid-off with an ill-timed drive
shortish length which doesn't quite carry to Sangakkara as he played on top of the bounce, with this one crashing into his stomach after the miss
slips in an almost-yorker length outside off which shapes in to Haddin as it passes the base of the stumps. Sangakkara was late on this attempted drive to the ball
lasers away a drive to this overpitched delivery, but picks out short cover right away
straddling on the pads as Dilshan is able to flick this away to deep backward square
drives this overpitched delivery to the man at mid-off, with the ball hitting his knee as he put in the sliding dive to get behind this. In the end, mid-on is able to recover the ball
turned away off middle and leg towards midwicket for one
works away this back of a length going across towards the leg side
nudges away a run to the leg side as Dilshan hares to the other end as the ball struggled away on the leg side
Sangakkara looking for the chip through extra-cover, as he hits this one just wide of Clarke at the position, who has to run to his right to fetch this
glances away this length delivery off the pads through midwicket
drills this fuller length going across to the man at short mid-off
slow bouncer going across which is penalised in the end by Ian Gould after some deliberation
dabs away a single through third man to get to the other end
full and on the pads as this is flicked away behind of square on the leg side
tries to dig out this yorker from Starc fired in outside off. Was well late on this attempt
goes round the wicket now as Dilshan drives away this fuller length to the man at cover
steers away this one flighted in on middle and leg through long on
driven back to the bowler in his follow through
sensibly drives away this Doherty special through long off for one

comes down the track to this one tossed up just outside off as he drives away through extra-cover, with Clarke doing well to get a hand to it at cover, before it is eventually pulled back before the rope
works with the angle to tickle this down fine leg for a brace
shimmies down now before readjusting to clip this away through square-leg
given plenty of flight as this one is struck away towards deep extra-cover
continues round the wicket as this one is turned away behind of square on the leg side
content to just tuck the bowler on the leg side for a comfortable single
eases away the spinner towards deep extra-cover
plays at this one tossed up on middle as he looked to get away a dab-and-run on the off side
advances down the track before driving this past the bowler to long off
content to just rotate strike as Clarke has succeeded in giving as little pace as possible to these two
tries to force away a slice through backward point, but is held by the fielder

given opportunity to rock onto the back foot to cut away this slightly short delivery towards deep point, with Maxwell the fielder firing in a hard throw to Haddin when he saw the second run being taken on, but the dive from Dilshan is able to get him home in the end

dropped the Australian captain hands Dilshan a life as the right-hander looked to slog-sweep over cow corner, with this going high over midwicket. Clarke, who was running backwards and to his left, is unable to hold onto the take after going for the dive
Sangakkara able to guide away a run through cover to get Dilshan back on stroke
sensibly pushes at this delivery sliding down leg towards mid-on, but is not keen to take the single
tries to work away a single through cover, but to no avail
another attempt through the same region is met with a similar result
gets to the milestone as he helps himself through deep fine leg with this paddle. Gets him to the 14,000 run-mark, which is met with lots of Sri Lankan flags and cheers from this exuberant crowd
now goes for the calculated strike over cow corner, which he is able to get wide of long on to find the boundary

gets deep in his crease before finessing this past backward point, who is unable to stop this despite the dive, as the outfield takes care of the rest. Timed that away so late off the bat, but it achieves the desired result. Pure class from Sanga
just bunts away this one on a shorter length to the leg side to end the over
Dilshan, who is now helmet-less, cuts away this slightly short delivery outside his off stump for a single

Sangakkara has an easy push at this Doherty slider going across him, with Haddin collecting this as it rushed past the bat and whipped off the bails when he thinks he sees Sangakkara overbalancing a touch, but replays confirm that the left-hander has his foot in place behind the crease
waltzes down before clipping away the bowler through square-leg, with the pressure from the batsmen putting the fielder off in the deep as he failed to pickup the ball on the first instance
eases away a single now square off the wicket as he brings up his third consecutive fifty-plus score of the tournament. This is now his 94th half-century in ODIs. What a legend
defended by Dilshan to the off side
works away the spinner to long off to keep the strike
tries to sweep away this leg-side delivery, but is far too early on it
steers away a run through square-leg as Dilshan reaches his fifty too
defended by the batsman
nurdles away a single through square-leg to get off the strike
Maxwell may have seen Dilshan positioning himself early for the reverse sweep as he fires one down leg, which Dilshan is unable to get any bat on as this continues through fine leg for byes
this time gets away a single with a swipe towards square-leg
works away a run on the off side as they switch ends
sliding one on a flatter trajectory as Sangakkara opts for the late cut through backward point which is reined in before the boundary
targets the vacant space at cow corner as he gets low to slog-sweep, which he connects beautifully to find the rope after one bounce
gets away a single now through backward square to bring Dilly on strike
Dilshan gives the strike back to his partner with a drive towards the covers
comes down the track and lifts Doherty over mid-off for yet another valuable boundary as the players break for drinks
tries to glide away this short of a length through backward point, but is unable to do so so when he picks out the fielder behind of square
shortish length which is clubbed away rather rashly to the leg side for one
tries to guide one past Smith at point, who puts in an athletic dive to intercept this
dabs away a run through third man to get off the strike
tucks away this delivery off the pads through to the long leg fielder
pushes at this fuller length outside of off which finds its way to mid-off
fails to pick a single on the off side behind of square
looks to nurdle a run through the leg side now, but is unable to find the desired space
lofts the bowler now straight over his head as this one lands safely near long on
cut away off the back foot towards the deep cover fielder
drags this one across Dilshan, affording him enough width to power this away through backward point for four
straying on the pads as this is clipped away for a single to the leg side
back-of-the-hand slower ball which Dilshan fails to pick as he looked for the clip off the pads
length delivery on the pads which is tucked away behind of square
on a good length and well outside off. Driven straight to the fielder at point
back-of-the-hand slower ball from Faulkner which almost gets the wicket as Sangakkara was early in closing the face of the bat, which ends up getting a leading edge towards third man
fuller length delivery and on Dilshan's pads which is turned straight to the fielder at square leg
another slower back-of-the-hand delivery from Faulkner. Dilshan dabs it straight to backward point as he wants a single, but is sent back
fires in a fuller length outside of off which is struck straight to the close-in fielder on the off side
delivers a fuller length which is struck back to him in his follow through
looks for some space on the leg-side, but is unable to locate any
continues to operate this slightly back of a length line on middle and leg as this is glanced away through the leg side
goes round the wicket now to Dilshan as he sends in a fuller length which Dilshan tried to get away, but fails to do so
tries him with a shorter one which Dilshan fails to put away with a hook through backward square. Still run the single though as this lands somewhere on the leg side
looking to force away a glide through backward point, but is stopped by the fielder in question
slower, full delivery, which goes across Dilshan as he fails to get away this late cut

Faulkner raps Dilshan right on middle and off as he plays all around this one. Goes up straightaway for the appeal, which the umpire corroborates soon after. Dilshan wants the review though after consulting with Sangakkara at the other end. It was another back-of-the-hand slower ball which definitely hit in line as there are four reds across the screen. Dilshan has to go, much to the delight of the Sydney crowd. Has been an excellent firestarter of a knock to get Sri Lanka's chase off on the best possible foot
slower, back of the length, which Mahela just fends away towards the off side

able to get to the other end, but only just, as he pushes away at this length delivery towards mid-on, before the fielder picked up and took a shy at the non-striker's, with Mahela well short of his ground. Would have been a horrible way to go if that had struck
picks up a single through midwicket to keep the strike
looks to guide this fuller one from Johnson past the bowler, but mid-on has Mitch's back
slipping down the leg side now as Sangakkara is able to tickle this one away through fine leg for four. Called leg byes by the umpire in the end
another full delivery on and around leg which is struck away to the close-in fielder on the leg side
slower yorker on middle and leg which is struck away to the same fielder as the previous delivery
overpitched as this one is driven straight past Mitchell, with the protection at mid-on doing well to dive and cut this off at the ring
short of a length which is tucked away to the leg side by Mahela
short of a length and just outside off as this one is dabbed straight to the fielder at backward point
full delivery straying on the pads which is flicked away uppishly towards deep midwicket
overpitched on middle and leg as Mahela just clips this away aerially through midwicket to find the boundary. With no one in the deep near there, turns out to be a very safe option
negotiates this change-up slower ball from Faulkner which goes across him
back-of-the-hand, loopy slower ball which is flicked away through backward square
eases away this leg-side slanting delivery off the pads to long leg
fails to pickup a single on the leg side as he locates the man at silly mid-on
looks to get a single off the pads, but is unable to time it away effectively
tests out his modified helmet with a nasty bouncer outside of off which Sangakkara chooses not to engage with
pitches this one up on middle and leg as Sangakkara locates the man at silly mid-on
tries to get away a single square off the wicket as he initially went down for the other end, but is sent back by Mahela when he sees the man behind square run towards the ball
leg-side delivery which is flicked away off the pads to the fielder at long leg
flighted delivery which is fended away to the leg side
eases away a single off the pads to deep midwicket
turns away a single on the leg side to get Sangakkara on strike
caresses away a comfortable single to deep extra-cover
gets in a good stride as this one is fended away to the off side
looks to get this one away through backward square as Mahela keeps the strike
picks up a single down the leg side with ease
bissects the gap at deep midwicket with this pickup shot that beats the dive from Watson, who was steaming in from cow corner
tries to force away a drive on the off side, but pinpoints mid-off
looks to slap away through cover point as he once again locates the fielder inside of the ring
shanks this one darted in on and around off as the close-in fielder picks up the ball on the bounce
tries to slap away a single through extra-cover, but is held by the fine, fielding effort from Finch
picks out the man at silly mid-on with this drive
tosses this one up on middle and off as they go up for the appeal after Mahela fudges the sweep, but the angle was suggesting this would continue on past off stump
picks up a single with a flick away through backward square
shimmies down to guide this one past the bowler to long off
eases away a single through midwicket to get Sangakkara on strike
Sangakkara gets away with this attempted sweep round the corner, with the ball catching the top edge to fly over the keeper, but luckily, away from any close-in fielders
decides to go after Watson straight away with this slice over to third man
merely pushes at this fuller length outside of off before stealing a single as the ball rolled towards mid-off
looks to drive away on the up, but Warner at backward point keeps him humble
eases away a single on the leg side for one
flicks away this fuller delivery off the pads through square-leg
punches this back of a length straight back to the bowler, but can't pinch the single
fuller length, going across, which is clipped away towards deep midwicket
flicks away this fuller one off the pads behind square on the leg side

Sangakkara looking to release the pressure as he comes down the track to slice away this fuller length over cover, with Maxwell at deep cover running forward unable to reach for this as it fell to the ground. Was a couple of feet away from holing out there
now swivels and pulls this to take this leg-side delivery over the short backward square to find the boundary
that half-chance costing Australia dearly at the moment as he now succeeds at tickling away four runs through fine leg
masterful from Sangakkara as he takes this slightly back of a length outside his off and ramps it over towards backward point to find the boundary after a few bounces
gets a single through fine leg to bring Sangakkara back on strike, much to the delight of the Sri Lankan masses in the crowd
bowls a peach of a delivery just outside of off as Sangakkara played just inside of the line. Dangerously close to nipping out the left-hander there
slips in a fuller delivery which is struck back to the bowler in his follow through
delivers a pearl of a yorker on middle and leg as Sangakkara just about digs this one away. Manages to get away an inside-edge through backward square to pickup a run and move to 99
has a go at this fuller length going across, but is late on it as Haddin completes the take from behind

Mahela takes on the arm of Clarke at mid-off after driving this fuller one from Starc, and has to pay the price as he nails down the stumps at the non-striker's as he looked to usher in Sangakkara to the strike. Was well out of his ground, despite putting in the dive, as he heads back to the pavilion. That could be a major blow to SL's chances as this chase gets into the business end of the innings
gets off the mark right away with a fend behind square to this shortish length going across him

and he becomes the first player in World Cup history to manage three hundreds in a row as he gets away this fuller delivery on the pads through backward square. Has been in magnificent form of late. He knows that he still has plenty of work left to do in this big chase
pick ups a single down fine leg as Mathews gets onto the hot seat
picks up a brace behind square on the leg side to this length delivery on and around leg
delivers the slower ball out of the back of the hand which is clipped away through square-leg by Mathews
backs away to the leg side in hopes of clearing the covers, but the lack of pace from this Faulkner delivery meant he could do not better than bunt this away to the off side
guides away this back of a length towards mid-off
attacks this shortish length outside of off as this is ramped away over backward point
tries to time away a drive to this fuller delivery on middle and leg, but picks out the man at extra-cover
steers away this almost yorker-length delivery through mid-off as Sri Lanka reach 200
digs out this yorker which follows him as the ball ends up near mid-on
able to keep out this yorker on off to end the over
defends away this back of a length delivery going across him
looks to get away a single on the leg side, but is unable to find any space
gets an edge to this attempted drive through mid-off, with the ball flying over towards backward point
fuller delivery straying on the pads as this one is tucked away behind of square

and that may very well be game for Sri Lanka as Kumar finally departs from the middle after looking to go after this Faulkner delivery, which was slipped in at a fuller length, as he ends up slicing over to the man at deep cover, who this time is able to get under it comfortably. There was some hesitation on the part of the fourth umpire to give this as replays show Faulkner just about, and I mean just about, got his foot behind the line. Really was touch and go there, but because a conclusive decision could not be reached, Sangakkara has to go. Has been a fine effort in this stirring chase so far
picks up a single through long off to end a successful over for the Australians
steers away a single to the man at mid-on as the ground has got noticeably quieter since that last wicket
content to just keep this one out from the bowler
eases away a run now on the leg side to bring Chandimal on strike for the first time
just jabs this one back to the bowler in his follow through
goes for the slog sweep through cow corner as Mathews now looks to guide this Sri Lanka chase
able to steer away a single through long off to keep the strike
puts pressure on Watson straightaway as he heaves this length delivery through the covers to find the boundary
looks to guide this one past the bowler now, but ends up hitting it a bit too straight to him
length delivery which is sent high and handsome over midwicket as he is able to pickup a maximum
fuller one which is flicked away through square-leg, as he is able to hustle the first one hard in order to come back for the second
tries to steer away a single through backward point, but is held by the fielder
advances a touch before finding another boundary through backward square to beat the man chasing from deep midwicket to the rope

fetches this one tossed up on middle and off as he looks for the big slog-sweep over midwicket, but ends up getting a top-edge which just carries over Warner, who went for a hop at backward square, before realising this one was sailing over comfortably
now gets back to belt Doherty towards cow corner for four. Excellent start for SL this over
fails to pickup a single on the leg side as he pinpoints the man at mid-on
just about steers one past a diving Doherty to pick out the fielder at long on
shuffles over to the leg side before blitzing an on drive through long on which has no one bothered to chase after it as it makes its way to the rope
Chandimal is proving a star here at the SCG as he now smashes the bowler over cow corner to finish off the over in some style
delivers a length delivery which is played away to the off side by the batsman
sees Mathews backing away a touch as he tried to follow him with a leg-side delivery, but ends up straying too far down the line
a direct hit from Clarke at mid-off would have meant curtains as Mathews hits this one straight to him before barreling to the other end
crashes away a drive through long off to get the captain on strike
able to work away a run towards the leg slip

this time forced away off the back foot through the off side, with this landing at extra-cover, who is able to pickup and fire in a throw at the non-striker's after there was an initial mix-up between the batsmen. Ends up missing the stumps, and with Faulkner there, he is unable to get to the ball and whip off the bails in time of the batsman making his ground
picks up a single through point to retain the strike
greets the left-arm quick with a slap behind of square to find a boundary through third man
flicks away through square-leg now as he is able to pickup a single
Chandimal really riding his luck here as he tries to heave Johnson over midwicket, but ends up falling away within the ring, with this one falling before the fielder could get anywhere near it
looks to send this one out of the ground as Johnson is penalised for this attempted wide yorker. Really shouldn't have been given a wide as Mitch asks the umpire soon after
shifts over to the off stump to try and hook away this shorter delivery through fine leg, but fails to make a connection
now offers a slower, short of a length delivery which Chandimal tries to swat away through midwicket, but is early on it after being deceived by the speed
moves over to his off stump before cutting this shortish length going across fiercely through backward point for a boundary
able to get Chandimal on strike with this swipe away towards the leg side
looks to send this full delivery over cow corner before getting an outside edge which flies over to a vacant third man for four
nudges away a single towards long on as he moves to 42 off 19
miscues this attempt heave over the leg side, with this one finding midwicket in the end
looks to target the deep square-leg boundary, but is lucky that this heave over the region did not fall straight to the fielder
gets this attempted yorker wrong as Chandimal is able to get nice and low to scythe this away through the covers to now move to 46 off 20
misses out on this back of a length going across him
tries to force away a drive through long on, but instead gets away an inside-edge behind of square
short and punished by the batsman as this is pulled away square off the wicket, but he can't find the boundary

Chandimal gets away with this top-edge over long leg as the man at backward square is unable to get to it. Brings up his fifty, which is greeted with great enthusiasm from the SL fans in the crowd. Still looks to be struggling though
gets into position to hook away this delivery on middle and leg towards deep fine leg

somehow pierces the gap between mid-on and midwicket as Starc exercises those long levers of his to put in a dive and pull this back inches from the rope. Excellent effort there to save his team a certain boundary
leg-side delivery which is helped down to deep fine leg
picks up a brace through long on as the odds have stacked again against SL

and now Mathews has to go after going at this shortish length from Watson, with the ball kissing the face as he went in for the attempted hook. Looks like he was surprised by the length as Haddin is able to take this comfortably from behind
steers away Watson on the front foot towards extra-cover
backs away before clattering this short ball high over extra-cover for a boundary
now slams this fuller length over long off. Perera still believes as the equation reduces to 85 off 48
tucks away this length delivery to the leg side

lets loose of the handle as he tried to swat Johnson over midwicket, with this one swirling high over mid-on, with Doherty getting under it safely to complete the catch. Took the pace of this shorter one as Perera threw everything but the kitchen sink at it
able to ease away a single to the off side to immediately get off strike
is well late on this fuller delivery shaping in from outside off stump
short and slipping down leg as the umpire swivels round to signal the scorers
has a go at this fuller one going across again, with this one fired in at 144 kph
keeps out this length delivery on middle and leg as they end up scraping through for the run
short delivery which is attacked by the batsman as the eventual top-edge sends this over to Doherty at third man, who puts in a fine dive before firing in a throw back towards the middle
looks to send this shorter one out of the stadium, but is late on it
another shorter one which is signalled one for the over as the batsman fails to make a connection
clubs away this length delivery slanting down leg as the acres of space means they are able to return for the second to bring up the Sri Lankan 300
looks for the cart over midwicket before offering up a thick outside edge which falls safe through third man for what seems like the umpteenth time today
comes down the track before swatting this away towards the bowler in his follow through
angles in a full delivery on the pads which is flicked away through square-leg
backs away, gets down on one knee, but fails to clear the covers with this attempted scythe
sends one crashing into the stumps of Prasanna, who just played all around this full yorker on middle which just tailed away a touch. Too good for the tail-ender as he walks off to the pavilion
delivers a sharp bouncer which Sachi has no clue about as it flies over his head
continues from round the wicket as Sachi is well late on this fuller delivery which threatens to castle his off stump as it rushes past
clips away this length delivery honing on the pads over towards deep midiwcket
glides away a single through backward point to get off the strike

Faulkner strikes right away for his captain as Tharanga, Sri Lanka's last recognised batsman, has to go after carting this back of a length straight to the man stationed at cow corner, who is able to get under it quite comfortably
slower delivery on and about leg which deceives Sachi
forces away a stroke down to long on to get off the strike
looks to have a go down the ground as he ends up inside-edging this failed bludgeon onto his shoes
delivers another back-of-the-hand slower delivery which has Malinga well early into his shot as he looked to pull this away
continues from round the wicket as he looks to hone in on off, but the slice away from Sachin through third man means he has to have a boundary added to his runs tally
fantastic yorker on middle which is spooned straight up to mid-off to end the game. There is a bit of confusion as to whether Chandimal would re-emerge, but it looks like the game is officially over
